name: Roopkund Trek
description: The Roopkund Trek is a high-altitude trek in the Himalayas, known for its mysterious lake which is filled with hundreds of human skeletons.
facts: The lake is at an altitude of 5,029 meters
The trek is about 53 km long
The best time to do the trek is from May to June and from September to October

name: Valley of Flowers Trek
description: The Valley of Flowers Trek is a popular trek in Uttarakhand, known for its stunning natural beauty and a vast variety of flowers.
facts: The Valley of Flowers is a UNESCO World Heritage Site
The trek is about 17 km long
The best time to do the trek is from July to September

name: Hampta Pass Trek
description: The Hampta Pass Trek is a popular trek in Himachal Pradesh, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the lush green valleys.
facts: The pass is at an altitude of 4,270 meters
The trek is about 35 km long
The best time to do the trek is from June to October

name: Chadar Trek
description: The Chadar Trek is a challenging trek in Ladakh, known for its frozen river and the extreme cold weather conditions.
facts: The trek is about 105 km long
The best time to do the trek is from January to February
The temperature can drop as low as -30Â°C

name: Kedarkantha Trek
description: The Kedarkantha Trek is a popular winter trek in Uttarakhand, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the snow-covered peaks.
facts: The summit is at an altitude of 3,850 meters
The trek is about 20 km long
The best time to do the trek is from December to March

name: Brahmatal Trek
description: The Brahmatal Trek is a winter trek in Uttarakhand, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the frozen lake.
facts: The summit is at an altitude of 3,850 meters
The trek is about 22 km long
The best time to do the trek is from December to March

name: Sandakphu Trek
description: The Sandakphu Trek is a popular trek in West Bengal, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the highest peak in West Bengal.
facts: The summit is at an altitude of 3,636 meters
The trek is about 32km long
The best time to do the trek is from April to June and from September to December

name: Har Ki Dun Trek
description: The Har Ki Dun Trek is a popular trek in Uttarakhand, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the lush green valleys.
facts: The valley is at an altitude of 3,556 meters
The trek is about 47 km long
The best time to do the trek is from April to June and from September to November

name: Markha Valley Trek
description: The Markha Valley Trek is a popular trek in Ladakh, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the unique culture of the region.
facts: The valley is at an altitude of 3,700 meters
The trek is about 82 km long
The best time to do the trek is from June to September

name: Rupin Pass Trek
description: The Rupin Pass Trek is a challenging trek in Uttarakhand, known for its stunning views of the Himalayas and the unique landscape of the region.
facts: The pass is at an altitude of 4,650 meters
The trek is about 52 km long
The best time to do the trek is from May to June and from September to October
